1.text: Pour the required amount of milk into a microwave-safe bowl.

2.text: Put a wooden chopstick in the dish before microwaving the milk.

3.text: Microwave the milk for 30 seconds on medium-high heat.

4.text: Remove the dish with hot pads and stir the milk with a wooden spoon.

5.text: Check the milk's temperature using a candy thermometer.

6.text: Keep heating, stirring, and checking the temperature every 30 seconds.

7.text: Stop microwaving the milk once it reaches 180 °F (82 °C).

8.text: Let the milk cool to room temperature before adding it to your recipe.

9.text: Pour the measured milk into a saucepan on the stove.

10.text: Turn the oven heat to medium-low.

11.text: Stir frequently until you see steam and bubbles appearing at the edge.

12.text: Remove the pan from the heat as soon as the milk starts to bubble.

13.text: Let the temperature cool down to about 105 °F (41 °C).
